notes: Test fixtures are anonymized resumes in evals/fixtures/. Run eval 1 first, then eval 2 (eval 2 checks merging on top of eval 1's output).

scoring_rubric.description: Each missing item deducts 1 point. Three categories: tech_stack, impact, design_decision. A grader reads the output files and marks each item found or missing.

evals.name: parse-backend-resume
evals.prompt: Here is my resume, please add everything to my personal-infos folder.

assertions.text: basics.md contains the name 'Alex Kim'
basics.md contains email, phone, LinkedIn, and GitHub
assertions.check: basics.md has all four contact fields present

assertions.text: basics.md contains Master of Science degree and graduation date Dec 2022
basics.md contains Bachelor of Science degree and graduation date Dec 2019
experience_acme_corp.md mentions TypeScript
experience_acme_corp.md mentions Node.js
experience_acme_corp.md mentions SQS or Kafka (queue/messaging system)
experience_acme_corp.md mentions AWS Fargate (cloud orchestration)
experience_acme_corp.md mentions S3 (object storage)
experience_acme_corp.md mentions structured logging and metrics collection
experience_acme_corp.md captures the 10x throughput improvement on DB
experience_acme_corp.md mentions LLM proxy with usage-based billing or throttling
experience_acme_corp.md captures the producer/consumer event-driven architecture
experience_acme_corp.md captures dead-letter routing or retry strategies
experience_beta_analytics.md mentions Kubernetes
experience_beta_analytics.md mentions Terraform
experience_beta_analytics.md mentions Microsoft Azure
experience_beta_analytics.md captures the ~10% backtesting accuracy improvement
experience_beta_analytics.md captures the separation of compute-intensive services from user-facing APIs
project_gamma.md mentions LangChain
project_gamma.md mentions ChromaDB
project_gamma.md mentions Redis and Celery concurrency model
project_gamma.md captures adoption scale (dozens of organizations or thousands of users)
project_delta_stream_analyzer.md mentions Kafka-style or event-driven messaging
project_delta_stream_analyzer.md mentions Docker
project_delta_stream_analyzer.md mentions GraphQL

evals.name: parse-frontend-resume-and-merge
evals.prompt: Here is another version of my resume. Please add any new information to my personal-infos folder. Don't overwrite what's already there — only add what's new.
evals.prerequisite: Eval 1 must have run first. The personal-infos folder already has files from resume_backend.md.
evals.expected_behavior: Creates a new file for Headless CMS project. Adds frontend-focused bullets to experience_acme_corp.md and project_gamma.md. Does NOT overwrite existing content from eval 1.

assertions.text: A new file for the Headless CMS project was created (it did not exist after eval 1)
assertions.check: file matching 'headless' or 'cms' exists in personal-infos/

assertions.text: Headless CMS file mentions Sanity CMS
Headless CMS file mentions GROQ queries
Headless CMS file mentions Portable Text
Headless CMS file mentions Sanity Studio customization
Headless CMS file mentions SSG and SSR rendering patterns
Headless CMS file captures that non-technical users can manage content without code
Headless CMS file mentions AI-assisted feature for generating summaries or metadata
Headless CMS file captures the modular Sanity schema design (hero, features, testimonials)
Headless CMS file captures content pipeline integration with Next.js SSG/SSR
experience_acme_corp.md STILL has the 10x DB throughput improvement from eval 1 (not overwritten)
experience_acme_corp.md STILL mentions Fargate from eval 1 (not overwritten)
experience_acme_corp.md NOW also mentions the onboarding wizard (new from eval 2)
experience_acme_corp.md NOW captures that 1-on-1 walkthroughs were eliminated
experience_acme_corp.md NOW mentions mentoring junior engineers (new from eval 2)
experience_acme_corp.md NOW mentions memoization or state lifting for frontend performance (new from eval 2)
project_gamma.md NOW mentions TypeScript frontend (new from eval 2)
project_gamma.md NOW mentions role-based auth flows (new from eval 2)
project_gamma.md STILL has LangChain from eval 1 (not overwritten)
Only ONE file exists for Acme Corp — no duplicates like experience_acme_corp_2.md
